alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 11 at 9:58PM CDT until March 11 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 945 PM CST. * At 857 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Cloudy, or 21 miles southeast of Clayton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Plunketville, Hochatown, Watson, Bethel, Battiest, Pickens, Ringold, Mount Herman and Sherwood. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
